topics.Architecture: Microservices, DDD, containere (Docker, Rocket...), event-sourcing, asynchronous services, fault tolerant systems, REST, dependency injection, web services without frameworks, web services without app servers, in-memory computing
topics.Mobile: Mobile first design, testing tools, multi-platform development, Apple Watch, iOS, Android, Windows Mobile
topics.Devops: Infrastructure as code, provisioning, continuous deployment
topics.Persistence: NoSQL, SQL, big data, cloud, grid
topics.Test code: Writing good tests, testing tools, continuous testing, TDD, BDD
topics.Programming: Paradigms, parallelism, typing, languages (C#, F#, Scala, Elixir, Clojure, etc.)
topics.Tools: Version control, build systems, SaaS, analysis (Sonar, R, etc.)
topics.Platforms and other: Cloud, Internet of Things, CMS, CRM, Office 365, EPiServer

submissions: A farewell to JavaScript? Looking at Scala.js

collections.time: 16:10-16:30 Break with wraps and other snacks, and hotel check-in
18:30-19:40 Break with hotel check-in, relaxing, waiting for dinner
19:40-19:45 Dinner groups meet in the lobby

collections.details: Erik Amundrud, Business Area Manager, Knowit Solutions Norway

collections.time: KDS is over! See you all next time!

Technical_debt_in_practice.speaker: Sten Christoffer Eliesen
Technical_debt_in_practice.title: Technical debt in practice
Technical_debt_in_practice.description:
There are two problems with debt: 1) Debt is troublesome to have. 2) Debt must always be paid back. This presentation explores the real practical consequences of technical debt and have you tackle it with your client.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Human_skills_for_better_password_practis.speaker: Cecilie Wian
Human_skills_for_better_password_practis.title: Human skills for better password practise
Human_skills_for_better_password_practis.description:
Humans are called the weakest link in any secure system.
There fore password policies try to force users to make more secure passwords. Forcing the user is not very sucsessfull, instead of making passwords difficult for computers, policies leads to difficult passwords for users. Users struggle to remember passwords, leading them to use common phrases, shorten passwords, and reuse passwords. Making passwords even more insecure

We know people are bad at passwords, but what are they good at? 

In my presentation i will discuss why user interfaces invites to bad password practises, before moving on to talk about human skills that can be used to shape users actions into more secure behaviour. Then giving exsamples of ways of making userfiendly security. 



 Difficulty: Beginner

The_challenges_of_hybrid_applications.speaker: Patrick Monslaup
The_challenges_of_hybrid_applications.title: The challenges of hybrid applications
The_challenges_of_hybrid_applications.description:
Hybrid mobile applications created with React Native lets web developers easily transition to mobile development, but is this a good thing? This talk explores the mixed experiences and pitfalls which hybrid apps bring based on actual project experience.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Tell_me_the_money!_How_I_made_my_bank_ta.speaker: Anders Breivik
Tell_me_the_money!_How_I_made_my_bank_ta.title: Tell me the money! How I made my bank talk to me by way of PSD2
Tell_me_the_money!_How_I_made_my_bank_ta.description:
Do you miss your personal bank teller? Me neither, but sometimes I wish I could hear a friendly voice tell me my account is not empty (yet). Thanks to The Payment Services Directive II, PSD2 among friends, and a bit of code, now I can. In this talk I will show I made my favourite voice commanded personal assistant integrate with my bank and talk to me.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Reverse_engineering_an_Android_app.speaker: Kristoffer Berge
Reverse_engineering_an_Android_app.title: Reverse engineering an Android app
Reverse_engineering_an_Android_app.description:
Nothing is worse than being forced to use bad applications. Why not just reverse engineer it and create a better version of the app for yourself?
 Outline:
I created my own app to open the door at my local bike parking facility. I'll be sharing the painstaking process i went through as well as a couple of different ways to uncover, and use the undocumented API behind the app.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Modern_Enterprise_Architecture_at_Statsb.speaker: Thomas Malt
Modern_Enterprise_Architecture_at_Statsb.title: Modern Enterprise Architecture at Statsbygg
Modern_Enterprise_Architecture_at_Statsb.description:
At Statsbygg, the Norwegian Directorate of Public Construction and Property, Knowit worked to develop a new and modern approach to Enterprise Architecture, focusing on combining Enterprise Architecture with Service design, Design Thinking, Lean Startup and Agile methodologies. 

This talk is about that work and our recommendation for approaching Enterprise Architecture in a modern product development organisation.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

A_story_about_an_agile_six_pizza_team.speaker: Joakim Lehn
A_story_about_an_agile_six_pizza_team.title: A story about an agile six pizza team
A_story_about_an_agile_six_pizza_team.description:
Over the past year I've had the challenge of leading a six pizza team consisting of 15 people, using an agile mindset and methodology. In this presentation I will tell the story of how the team has evolved and experimented with different agile methods, trying to use the team size as a benefit instead of an disadvantage. 
 Outline:
- Part 1: Introduction
* Introduction to agile principles, and why teams should be kept small
* Short introduction about myself
* introduction to the project and the team
- Part 2: Entry point
* How the team used to function, and why it did not work
* Challenges as we grew
- Part 3: Team of teams
* Idea
* Challenges
* How it worked
- Part 4: Challenges being a way too large a team
- Part 5: Benefits
* Benefits being a way too large a team
* Why more people can make the team more agile
- Part 6: Summary
* What have we tried
* What worked and what did not work
* Lessons learned
* Current status
* Thoughts about the future

 Difficulty: Intermediate

Bygg_ditt_eget_smartspeil_med_Magic_Mirr.speaker: Jan Henrik Gundelsby
Bygg_ditt_eget_smartspeil_med_Magic_Mirr.title: Bygg ditt eget smartspeil med Magic Mirror og stemmestyring
Bygg_ditt_eget_smartspeil_med_Magic_Mirr.description:
Jeg har bygget mitt eget smarte speil i gangen hjemme. Dette er gjort med Open Source-rammeverket Magic Mirror og har integrasjoner med diverse komponenter for å vise familiens kalender, været og når bussen går, samt hvilken musikk som spiller i hvilket rom i huset med Sonos. 

Jeg går også gjennom hvordan speilet ble bygget med RaspBerry Pi, en monitor og litt snekkerarbeid.

I tillegg viser foredraget hvordan speilet kan stemmestyres med Alexa, AWS Lambda (serverless)!
 Difficulty: Beginner

OP_DevOps_with_Azure_DevOps.speaker: Øyvind Kristiansen
OP_DevOps_with_Azure_DevOps.title: OP DevOps with Azure DevOps
OP_DevOps_with_Azure_DevOps.description:
Azure DevOps has been chosen as source control and continuous integration solution for Knowit Experience Bergen. In this talk, I will show you how we use Azure Devops, together with some nice tips and tricks.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Automated'_UI_testing_in_the_hands_of_th.speaker: Håvard Olsen
Automated'_UI_testing_in_the_hands_of_th.title: Automated' UI testing in the hands of the customer
Automated'_UI_testing_in_the_hands_of_th.description:
Automated UI testing is an incredible tool that usually is only available for developers. What if we gave the customer the ability to trigger, schedule, and orchestrate such tests?
We are creating a platform with this exact purpose.
This talk dives into the idea behind this, how it is built, and future possibilities.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Reptile_Framework:_A_novel_Python-based_.speaker: Markku Degerholm
Reptile_Framework:_A_novel_Python-based_.title: Reptile Framework: A novel Python-based Test Automation Framework for Developers!
Reptile_Framework:_A_novel_Python-based_.description:
We like Robot Framework because it is easy to use and has nice reports. We love Python because it's a nice language for many things. We hate Robot Framework because it's horrible as a programming language. Being 100% Python but able to output Robot FW reports, the Reptile Framework tries to combine the best of both worlds. But beware, it's still only a prototype and the project is looking for volunteers!

Take your laptop with you, in this workshop you will be able to try it out!
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Machine_learning_in_the_underwater_domai.speaker: Jonas Ekström Berg
Machine_learning_in_the_underwater_domai.title: Machine learning in the underwater domain
Machine_learning_in_the_underwater_domai.description:
Combining commercially available sensors, deep knowledge in underwater systems and machine learning to create game changing solutions.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

En_innføring_i_3D-visualisering_på_Web.speaker: Ole Eskild Steensen
En_innføring_i_3D-visualisering_på_Web.title: En innføring i 3D-visualisering på Web
En_innføring_i_3D-visualisering_på_Web.description:
Visualiseringer på Web har lenge vært forbeholdt til to dimensjoner. Og ofte er det nok. Men hva om en ønsker å gi dataene litt mer dybde og muligheten til å utforske dem også i den 3. dimensjonen? Biblioteket three.js gjør det enkelt for hvem som helst å lage visualiseringer i tre dimensjoner og inneholder flere kraftfulle abstraheringer over WebGL APIet. Dette foredraget vil gi en rask introduksjon til three.js og vise praktiske eksempler på hva det kan brukes til.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Route__\"66\"_to_DevOps.speaker: Sari Alander
Route__\"66\"_to_DevOps.title: Route  "66" to DevOps
Route__\"66\"_to_DevOps.description:
This is story of DevOps Journey. First, we look “Why” companies want to start the journey. Then presentation continues by describing “How” -part of change process on way to DevOps.  We will shortly look what it meant to be Devops in several areas like: Culture and Motivation, Organization, Agile and Lean Development, Tools and Technology, Measuring and Continues Improvement and last but not least how to build DevOps skills and Knowledge. Finally, we will discuss all amazing findings we had during our road trip on Route  "66" and where to start.
 Difficulty: Beginner

DevOps_”secret”_ingredient__-_People_Mot.speaker: Sari Alander
DevOps_”secret”_ingredient__-_People_Mot.title: DevOps ”secret” ingredient  - People Motivation
DevOps_”secret”_ingredient__-_People_Mot.description:
DevOps is lot about people and how they motivate to their work. This presentation is a mixture of theory of motivation and workshops to understand person’s own drivers and motivation.  

 Outline:
15 minutes theory
20 Minutes Maslows Hierarchy workshop
15 minutes theory
20 minutes Moving motivators workshop
 Difficulty: Beginner

Unngå_designgjeld_-_Ikke_slipp_designtrå.speaker: Eirik Lillejordet
Unngå_designgjeld_-_Ikke_slipp_designtrå.title: Unngå designgjeld - Ikke slipp designtråden
Unngå_designgjeld_-_Ikke_slipp_designtrå.description:
Har du noen gang plukket opp designarbeid etter lang tids fravær, enten eget eller andres? Det har jeg. Designgjeld er like virkelig og kostbart som teknisk gjeld.

Designgjeld kan oppstå i mange former og fasonger, og kan virke som et fjell å bestige idet man kommer inn på et prosjekt. Når autonome og tverrfaglige team nå blir vanligere så øker hastigheten og da også forekomsten av designgjeld.

Basert på ferske erfaringer fra et stort statlig prosjekt vil jeg snakke om hva designgjeld er, hvilke implikasjoner det har i utviklingsprosessen og hvordan du kan forholde seg til det. 
 Difficulty: Beginner

Kubernetes_for_developers.speaker: Göran Damberg
Kubernetes_for_developers.title: Kubernetes for developers
Kubernetes_for_developers.description:
Introduction to kubernetes from a developer standpoint
 Difficulty: Beginner

Windows_PowerShell_anno_2019.speaker: Håvard Slettvold
Windows_PowerShell_anno_2019.title: Windows PowerShell anno 2019
Windows_PowerShell_anno_2019.description:
Windows PowerShell has had a face lift in recent years, and in many areas it now compares well to most unix terminals. Get some perspective on command line tooling, prompt look-and-feel and check out bash available through Ubuntu subsystem.
 Outline:
This talk will be a live demo showing some features that makes PowerShell worth using over other terminals such as git-bash, cmder and cygwin.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Developing_SpinSling_in_Unity_-_Experien.speaker: Simon Østrem
Developing_SpinSling_in_Unity_-_Experien.title: Developing SpinSling in Unity - Experiences of a small team
Developing_SpinSling_in_Unity_-_Experien.description:
A short overview of my experiences with developing a game in Unity 3D as a small team on our spare time.
 Outline:
This will be a talk outling the challenges we faced whendeveloping games with limited funding, time and experience
 Difficulty: Beginner

Santander_-_Open_Banking_and_PSD2.speaker: Ben Yuen
Santander_-_Open_Banking_and_PSD2.title: Santander - Open Banking and PSD2
Santander_-_Open_Banking_and_PSD2.description:
What is psd2 and what does it mean for Santander Bank?
- The creation of a whole new open banking platform for Santander Bank.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Blazor.Net_-_Brave_new_feature_off_web_d.speaker: Fredrik Claesson
Blazor.Net_-_Brave_new_feature_off_web_d.title: Blazor.Net - Brave new feature off web development
Blazor.Net_-_Brave_new_feature_off_web_d.description:
Lorem ipsum
 Outline:
Lorem ipsum
 Difficulty: Intermediate

WireGuard,_VPN_for_the_future.speaker: Sverre Johann Bjørke
WireGuard,_VPN_for_the_future.title: WireGuard, VPN for the future
WireGuard,_VPN_for_the_future.description:
WireGuard is a new, fast and simple technology for VPN. In this presentation I will talk about what it is, how it works and show how you can set up your own VPN.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Down_the_rabbit_hole.speaker: David Lund
Down_the_rabbit_hole.title: Down the rabbit hole
Down_the_rabbit_hole.description:
or "here is the source code make like it is but better!"...
 Outline:
This is a short autopsy of my latest project where most of the blame is my own
 Difficulty: Beginner

Create_your_own_synthesizer_with_Rust.speaker: John-Olav Storvold
Create_your_own_synthesizer_with_Rust.title: Create your own synthesizer with Rust
Create_your_own_synthesizer_with_Rust.description:
Rust is a reliable systems programming language providing bare-metal performance in a modern wrapping. It guarantees memory and thread-safety without garbage collection, offers great tooling and an amazing community — in fact, Rust has been voted the most loved programming language according to the Stack Overflow Developer Survey three years in a row. The language is experiencing rapid adaptation in multiple industries ranging from game development to backend systems.

In this workshop, we will explore Rust and create a simple synthesizer that can be played with your computer keyboard. We will also implement rudimentary sound effects. The goal of this workshop is to learn some of the basics of Rust through a hands-on project, and no prior knowledge of Rust or audio processing is required.
 Outline:
We start off with some basic sound theory ~ 15 min

We then have a fundamental introduction to Rust, focusing on the aspects required to complete the tasks.

For the remainder of the time we assist the participants as they progress through the tasks. When opportune, we will present our proposed solution for the tasks, giving those who lag behind the opportunity to catch up.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Functional_patterns_and_techniques_in_C#.speaker: Alexandra  Dobrescu
Functional_patterns_and_techniques_in_C#.title: Functional patterns and techniques in C#
Functional_patterns_and_techniques_in_C#.description:
What is functional programming? How well does C# support functional programming? 
 Difficulty: Beginner

Some_title_concerning_Scrumish_things.speaker: Marit Hellestø
Some_title_concerning_Scrumish_things.title: Some title concerning Scrumish things
Some_title_concerning_Scrumish_things.description:
Lorem Ipsum
 Outline:
Lorem Ipsum
 Difficulty: Beginner

VS_Code_can_do_that_too.speaker: Stian Sanden Skauge
VS_Code_can_do_that_too.title: VS Code can do that too
VS_Code_can_do_that_too.description:
Ever thought that VS Code was just a text editor? VS code is a full fledged IDE for (almost) any language out there. Let's not look at the 2000+ language extensions and instead have a look at the features you should use in your day to day work.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Blazor_-_The_.NET_implementation_for_Web.speaker: Stian Sanden Skauge
Blazor_-_The_.NET_implementation_for_Web.title: Blazor - The .NET implementation for WebAssembly, well... sort of
Blazor_-_The_.NET_implementation_for_Web.description:
Blazor is a new framework for creating SPAs using C# (or any .net language). The framework is still in development, but last year Microsoft announced the project will be included in ASP.NET Core. In this talk I'll introduce Blazor and the features added to ASP.NET Core 3.0.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

No_idea_right_now.speaker: kriser karto
No_idea_right_now.title: No idea right now
No_idea_right_now.description:
I will fill this stuff in later
 Outline:
Its probably going to be something not that technical, but mor erelated to work and processes and maybe slightly peptalkish
 Difficulty: Beginner

Episerver_eCommerce_Single_Page_Applicat.speaker: Axel Nilsson Svegard
Episerver_eCommerce_Single_Page_Applicat.title: Episerver eCommerce Single Page Application
Episerver_eCommerce_Single_Page_Applicat.description:
How to tackle the difficulties around creating a single page application for an Episerver eCommerce site.
Solving Episerver built in functionality like on-page-editing.
Server side rendering using node services to run javascript server side.

 Difficulty: Advanced

How_does_Blockchain_work_101.speaker: Ove Holm
How_does_Blockchain_work_101.title: How does Blockchain work 101
How_does_Blockchain_work_101.description:
A run-through of how Blockchain works and the idea behind it
 Difficulty: Beginner

Design_Thinking,_Lean,_and_Agile:_An_Inn.speaker: Sofija Ivanova
Design_Thinking,_Lean,_and_Agile:_An_Inn.title: Design Thinking, Lean, and Agile: An Innovation Crash Course
Design_Thinking,_Lean,_and_Agile:_An_Inn.description:
Design Thinking, Lean, and Agile are three popular methodologies for creating new products, services and startups. In this talk, we explore their underlying principles, similarities, and differences.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Who_is_an_orbiting_developer_and_you_sho.speaker: Sofija Ivanova
Who_is_an_orbiting_developer_and_you_sho.title: Who is an orbiting developer and you should be one
Who_is_an_orbiting_developer_and_you_sho.description:
This talk will address issues with the design handoff process, as well as why and how the developers can be involved in the design process.
 Difficulty: Beginner

What_Is_This_Cloud_Native_Thing_Anyway?.speaker: Michael Åhs
What_Is_This_Cloud_Native_Thing_Anyway?.title: What Is This Cloud Native Thing Anyway?
What_Is_This_Cloud_Native_Thing_Anyway?.description:
The past few years the we have been dealing with buzzword-heavy area microservices technology. We have been trying to come to terms with what it all means and how do you successfully combine Agile/Lean, Continuous Delivery, Cloud and DevOps with Microservices? This is a talk exploring what Cloud Native means and how to be a better consultant in the world of microservices. 
 Outline:
Will be added
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Surviving_as_the_New_Technical_Leader_-_.speaker: Michael Åhs
Surviving_as_the_New_Technical_Leader_-_.title: Surviving as the New Technical Leader - Real Life Stories
Surviving_as_the_New_Technical_Leader_-_.description:
Being the new technical leader is not easy. With lots of humor speaker will  share three real life stories that all went pretty bad, including its learning lessons. Join this session if you want to learn how to thrive in a technical leadership role.
 Outline:
Will be provided
 Difficulty: Beginner

GPGPU_med_WebGL_2.0.speaker: Jens Kristoffer Markussen
GPGPU_med_WebGL_2.0.title: GPGPU med WebGL 2.0
GPGPU_med_WebGL_2.0.description:
Grafikkort brukes til mer enn bare grafikkrendering, de er også brukt til å akselerere andre beregningsintensive oppgaver innen computer vision, simulering, video-enkoding, og lignende. Med WebGL så er grafikkortet sitt potensiale tilgjengelig fra en nettleser og 2.0 spesifikasjonen, samt en "Compute Shader" utvidelse som kommer, åpner for nye muligheter for hva som er mulig i en nettleser uten nettleserutvidelser.

Demonstrasjon av potensiale med å vise en post-prosesseringspipeline av webkamera video i sanntid
 Difficulty: Advanced

Write_your_own_CSS_goddammit.speaker: Siddise Hirpa
Write_your_own_CSS_goddammit.title: Write your own CSS goddammit
Write_your_own_CSS_goddammit.description:
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, but it could as well stand for Chaos Style Sheets. Developers both talk about how stupid easy CSS is and how difficult it is in the same sentence. In addition to that there are endless debates about if you should learn Sass, Less, OOCSS, BEM, SMACSS, CSS-in-JS or just use an existing design system like Material or Bootstrap, or worst-case scenario copy/paste it from a design delivery tool!

I'll talk about it all, so you could stop worrying and start writing your own goddamn CSS.
 Difficulty: Beginner

De_andre_måtene_å_bruke_Linqpad_på.speaker: Andrew Rutherfurd
De_andre_måtene_å_bruke_Linqpad_på.title: De andre måtene å bruke Linqpad på
De_andre_måtene_å_bruke_Linqpad_på.description:
Mange kjenner allerede til Linqpad, men det kan kanskje brukes til mer enn du gjør nå?

Linqpad kan brukes til mange forskjellige typer oppgaver. Demo av:
- småfunksjoner
- db spørringer i Linq eller SQL
- kalle metoder i dll'er i andre prosjekt
- "Dump()"
- API-kall (?)
 Difficulty: Beginner

Good_ideas_faster_-_A_fast_introduction_.speaker: Siddise Hirpa
Good_ideas_faster_-_A_fast_introduction_.title: Good ideas faster - A fast introduction to Google Design Sprints
Good_ideas_faster_-_A_fast_introduction_.description:
It is time consuming to come up with something new or change something old, and we often filter ourselves before the ideas are even written down. It's even harder when the product team is working in silo's.

Google Design Sprints are all about making it easy to bring design thinking to your process, get people together and get ideas written, prototyped and tested faster! Can you keep up?

TL;DR: What, how, when and why.
 Difficulty: Beginner

Speeding_up_your_Entity_Framework.speaker: Espen A. Svendsen
Speeding_up_your_Entity_Framework.title: Speeding up your Entity Framework
Speeding_up_your_Entity_Framework.description:
Writing LINQ-queries is not that difficult, but writing LINQ-queries that are fast can be challenging. This talk will demonstrate several easy techinques of speeding up your existing queries, and what you should think about when moving forward. 
 Difficulty: Intermediate

The_Future_of_Cross-Platform_Development.speaker: Eivind Furuberg
The_Future_of_Cross-Platform_Development.title: The Future of Cross-Platform Development - Flutter
The_Future_of_Cross-Platform_Development.description:
Google's mobile development framework Flutter launched version 1 late last year and with it shared their ambition to target more platforms.

Wouldn't it be nice if all your end-user facing applications 
could be written in the same source and compiled natively to all your target platforms from Mobile, Web, Desktop and even embedded devices?
It sounds too good to be true!
 Outline:
Exploring Flutter's cross-platform capabilities
 Difficulty: Beginner

Why_your_next_mocking_framework_should_b.speaker: Espen A. Svendsen
Why_your_next_mocking_framework_should_b.title: Why your next mocking framework should be NSubstitute
Why_your_next_mocking_framework_should_b.description:
NSubstitute is an lightweight, yet powerful, modern mocking framework for .Net unit tests. This talk will give an introduction to how you get started, and will demonstrate the most useful features and pitfalls
 Difficulty: Beginner

Getting_to_know_Flutter.speaker: Amir Roosta
Getting_to_know_Flutter.title: Getting to know Flutter
Getting_to_know_Flutter.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for creating high-quality, beautiful native experiences on iOS and Android in record time. It is a free and open-source platform with a large and increasingly growing community and it is already being used for production applications; such as Alibaba and Google Ads
This presentation intends to introduce the Flutter framework and showcase its advantages and powerful tooling which would make it a fast, cross-platform and productive engine to build production-ready solutions, soon even beyond mobile.
 Difficulty: Intermediate

From_monotlith_to_microservices_in_finan.speaker: Henning Johan Kvalheim
From_monotlith_to_microservices_in_finan.title: From monotlith to microservices in finance
From_monotlith_to_microservices_in_finan.description:
Experiences of implementing microservices in one of Norways largest financial institutions. We dive into the nitty-gritty details, what worked, what failed, what still remains to be solved.
 Outline:
From monolith to microservices
Boot, templating and scripting
Build pipeline
Security platform, JWT, tokens
Technical platform on OpenShift with Kubernetes and Docker
From on-premise to cloud
Pros and Cons
The Road Ahead
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Designa_skalbara_system_med_Azure:_Insik.speaker: Magnus Backeus
Designa_skalbara_system_med_Azure:_Insik.title: Designa skalbara system med Azure: Insikter från tre projekt
Designa_skalbara_system_med_Azure:_Insik.description:
Som arkitekt i de tre senaste projekten, har jag samlat på mig insikter som jag känner är värda att dela med mig till er. Både bra och dåliga erfarenheter som kan hjälpa er startsträcka bli kortare och rakare. Jag djupdyker ned i kod men också håller helhetsperspektivet kring arkitektur och motiverar vissa beslut. Min förhoppning är att efter seminariet har ni samlat in kunskaper och mod för att ta er an nya utmaningar med Azure
 Difficulty: Intermediate

Distribuerade_teams_-_dos_&_don'ts.speaker: Victor Hultfeldt
Distribuerade_teams_-_dos_&_don'ts.title: Distribuerade teams - dos & don'ts
Distribuerade_teams_-_dos_&_don'ts.description:
En inblick i mina erfarenheter av att vara en del av ett agilt distribuerat team och utmaningarna som det medför.
 Difficulty: Beginner

A_machine_learning_framework_for_identif.speaker: Mads Wiemann
A_machine_learning_framework_for_identif.title: A machine learning framework for identification of faulty electrical meters

Internet_Of_Things._From_a_Thing_to_the_.speaker: Wille Esteche
Internet_Of_Things._From_a_Thing_to_the_.title: Internet Of Things. From a Thing to the Internet. A whole flow by mobile data.
Internet_Of_Things._From_a_Thing_to_the_.description:
We build a small IoT system from a thing all the way to internet using mobile data.
The idea is to show how a single flow works and to inspire you to make your own.
 Difficulty: Beginner
